title: News. Views. Hughes - October 29, 2019 (17:00 ET)
text:
China slams FCC for latest shot in trade war

The FCC plans to place more restrictions on Chinese telecomm giants Huawei and ZTE. China condemned the move. Meanwhile, more than 130 US companies have applied for licenses to sell non-sensitive goods to Huawei, but the Trump Administration has yet to grant them. RT America’s Sara Montes de Oca reports. Then Christy Ai joins Steve Malzberg (in for Scottie Nell Hughes) on Hong Kong’s receding economy and struggling tourist industry after four months of protests.



Impeachment saga: President Trump did nothing wrong?

Former chair of the Florida Democratic Party Mitch Ceasar and Julio Rivera of Reactionary Times join Steve Malzberg (in for Scottie Nell Hughes) to debate the revelations from Army Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman’s testimony as part of the ongoing impeachment inquiry into President Trump.
description:
China slams FCC for latest shot in trade war
The FCC plans to place more restrictions on Chinese telecomm giants Huawei and ZTE
